explanation:
OS_common_record_t — need the full struct definition to know which fields are mutable. If the record is never modified by this function (and could be treated as const), MISRA would favor declaring the local pointer as pointer-to-const (e.g. const OS_common_record_t *).

OS_common_record_t::name_entry — the exact type of the name_entry field (char * vs const char *) determines whether the data copied from it should be const-qualified; if name_entry is logically immutable it should be declared const char *.

OS_ObjectIdGlobalFromToken — prototype/return type is required to know whether this function returns a mutable (OS_common_record_t *) or const-qualified pointer; that affects whether the caller can/should hold a const pointer.

OS_ObjectIdGetById — prototype is needed to see how the token is produced and whether obtaining the token implies mutable access to the underlying record (i.e., whether subsequent use of the record must be non-const because the API allows/modifies it).

OS_ObjectIdRelease — prototype is needed to check whether releasing the token could modify the underlying object or requires the caller to have non-const access; this affects whether the token-to-record relationship forces non-const pointers.

OS_strnlen — its parameter type (typically const char *) documents that reading name_entry does not require a non-const pointer; helps justify const qualification of name_entry if appropriate.

OS_CHECK_POINTER / OS_CHECK_SIZE — macros used at the top could expand to code that inspects or modifies the pointer (e.g., sets errno, logs, or validates); their definitions are needed to ensure they do not mutate buffer (which would prevent making it const) or otherwise force particular pointer qualifications.

memcpy — prototype/semantics (void *memcpy(void *dest, const void *src, size_t)) show that the source may be const-qualified; this supports marking name_entry as const char * if it is not modified.

These symbols are sufficient to determine whether the function's pointers (notably record and record->name_entry) could or should be declared with const qualifiers under the MISRA guidance.
